availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John G. Carlisle (Kenton County attorney and Ninth Judicial District Commonwealth’s Attorney pro tem)

body.p: Kenton County attorney and Ninth Judicial District Commonwealth’s Attorney pro tem. Kenton County native. Married Mary F. Carlisle. Father of William K. Carlisle. Ninth Judicial District Commonwealth’s Attorney pro tem in 1864.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 293. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 2, p. 103. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, Kentucky, Sixth Congressional District, Kenton County, 1863, p. 85. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 6, p. 6. “John Griffith Carlisle,” Find A Grave, August 14, 2000, memorial no. 11747. Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), Ancestry, Covington, Deaths, 1910.
